intro: Riocreuxia alexandrina, commonly known as the Alexandrine thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, with upright stems and spiny leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. The plant is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
